issue.title: Map-like container deduction guides should use pair<Key, T>, not pair<const Key, T>

discussion.p: With the deduction guides as specified currently, code like this doesn't work:
Same problem occurs with multimap, unordered_map and unordered_multimap. The problem is in deduction guides like

blockquote.pre: template<class Key, class T, class Compare = less<Key>, class Allocator = allocator<pair<const Key, T>>> map(initializer_list<pair<const Key, T>>, Compare = Compare(), Allocator = Allocator()) -> map<Key, T, Compare, Allocator>;

discussion.p: The pair<const Key, T> is not matched by a pair<int, int>, because int can't match a const Key. Dropping the const from the parameter of the deduction guide makes it work with no loss of functionality.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4687.

li.p: Change p3, class template map synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: […] template<class Key, class T, class Compare = less<Key>, class Allocator = allocator<pair<const Key, T>>> map(initializer_list<pair<const Key, T>>, Compare = Compare(), Allocator = Allocator()) -> map<Key, T, Compare, Allocator>; […] template<class Key, class T, class Allocator> map(initializer_list<pair<const Key, T>>, Allocator) -> map<Key, T, less<Key>, Allocator>; […]

li.p: Change p3, class template multimap synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: […] template<class Key, class T, class Compare = less<Key>, class Allocator = allocator<pair<const Key, T>>> multimap(initializer_list<pair<const Key, T>>, Compare = Compare(), Allocator = Allocator()) -> multimap<Key, T, Compare, Allocator>; […] template<class Key, class T, class Allocator> multimap(initializer_list<pair<const Key, T>>, Allocator) -> multimap<Key, T, less<Key>, Allocator>; […]
